comments.text:
It was a nice ending, kinda lost me a little in the last two episodes, though.

[Always liked this part of the OP so here is a random gif.](http://i.imgur.com/yyMduyq.gifv)

Yea I agree with you. In a show that is so extremely based in fiction that your suspension of disbelief should be willing to accept almost anything, the "We're making gears appear out of thin air, and work without touching one another, because *friendship*" really shattered me out of the groove I get into when I watch a show. Seeing that happen at the end of episode 11 and the beginning of 12 really just made me lose interest in this show entirely...
According to some other comments from earlier episodes, things make more sense. Sorta. It's explained better in the light novels

According to the delusional old man, Y has rewritten the physics of their sandbox universe; so I interpret them creating gears out of nothing as them having assessed command console mode create_item(). Either that or it's just the animation being lazy and not showing the robotic arms assembling gears from materials.

Well, I'd argue that it was heavily implied that the two of them are related to Y in some way and if they posess even a small portion of Y's power then it wouldn't be impossible for them to create gears on the spot. The same could be said for the synced work as well, they basically shared consciousness, so they were one entity at that point rather than two.
I agree completely. The show gave us plenty to suspend disbelief. Was the show Campy hell? Yeah. That's why I love it.

Old man, [how the fk can you say anything about being human when you just shot and wanted to kill a pure child](http://i.imgur.com/O1oMRo3.jpg), even if she is an android one!? Not to mention, that the planet's being dead and if it wasn't rebuilt on gears, you would be just fking dead.  
  
I must say, that I didn't fully understand how fixing the weather control system helped them shut down the beam, but...okay.  
  
Also if I knew you can [grow sakura trees](http://i.imgur.com/BQT0UIH.jpg) in minutes using clockworks, I would study to become a clockwork master myself.  
  
[She definetely ascended from a baka tsundere to a violent tsundere.](http://i.imgur.com/MDArqvi.jpg)  
  
[RyuZU knows the weak spots to hit best with being savage, as always.](http://i.imgur.com/l1KWKfP.jpg)
  
Well, literally - [FUCK THE GOVERNMENT!](http://i.imgur.com/nEyercE.jpg)  
  
This show definetely was fun and enjoyable to watch, though I must say, that it started much better, than it finished. I really liked the world building, concepts and character designs. Would definetely read the LN if it was available in English.  
  
**Solid 8/10 for me!**  
  
PS: [If the planet was a molten core mess before, where did Y get so much water for the ocean?](http://i.imgur.com/EIhV6aC.jpg)

> PS: If the planet was a molten core mess before, where did Y get so much water for the ocean?

I mean, I'm just going by the laws of logic and our universe, which don't particularly apply here, but if Earth imploded, the water would *still* be there, it's just that it would get really hot and boil. But it would stay in the close vicinity of the remains of Earth, after all they are still bound by gravity.

Marie is not a tsundere. She's just a, hmm, protective mother. Gotta protect AnchoR from bad influences.

Also it looks like their crew just said fuck to every government on the planet. "We're gonna come to fix and overhaul your gear, whether you want it or not. Fear the terrorists Naoto and Marie."

8/10 for me too !

[](#hackadollthumbsup)

> where did Y get so much water for the ocean?

Using clockworks, duh. You just mix-mash some gears, add some golden light and blooming sakura trees, and you get water.

(Obligatory LN reader explanation) I thought they will save old man's motivation for this episode, but they just skip it. So here goes:

[Detail from LN](/s "Gennai was a researcher who dedicated his life trying to figure out how the hell does a planet made of clockwork works. After all the failures, he comes to hate Y for creating this nonsensical planet that he has to live in. After he discussed with Naoto in deep underground where he stated that Y cannot be human, since what he made is still not understandable by humanity after 1,000 years. Naoto gave him the answer shown in anime that he might gave up, but he does not speak for humanity.")

[Detail from LN](/s "From that alone, Gennai concluded that Naoto is Y himself and decide to come out of his hiding and start Yatsukahagi just to teach Y a lesson. When he said it out loud via broadcast, everyone just (rightfully) think he's gone senile.")
how many volumes it adapt??
Is it stated in the LN whether or not Naoto and Marie actually are Y or are they just normal talented humans?
i hope they will do a better adaptation because the LN explanations make it very well detailed tbh

That makes a lot of sense.

Is there anything about how they make up gears from nowhere?
~~magic~~science

I know this wasn't an anime most people cared for, but damn. What can I say? I had a lot of fun watching it and that is all that matters to me.

Naoto was a great MC, RyuZU with her sharp tongue, and all the other characters were fun. The ending was pretty good and I want to see a S2.

I'm still wondering why that guy is still in the body of a sex robot, even with Halter getting a new body again. I mean, it's funnier this way, but still.

I had very high hopes for this show, got disappointed in the first few episodes, but then it started growing back to me again. I haven't been disappointed by this anime since my initial expectations failed, and I enjoyed it quite a lot. Naoto and Marie, most notably, were really interesting characters.

> I'm still wondering why that guy is still in the body of a sex robot, even with Halter getting a new body again. I mean, it's funnier this way, but still.

Doesn't seem to bother ~~him~~ _her_ anymore. Maybe ~~he~~ _she_ realized that it was closer to her personality, after all. I'd totally love to have a badass sexy chick like this on my team if I was in their situation.

Well the ending was... alright, I guess. 

Maybe I'll check out the light novels now. I was pretty hyped for this and it ended up being kinda disappointing at almost every level... gonna have to go with a solid 5/10 overall.

My biggest question from this series is this:

**HOW THE FUCK IS THERE AN OCEAN ON A PLANET MADE OF GEARS?!**
I think your first question should be how is there a planet made of gears in the first place?
Well, it's canon so I will accept it.

This was..something

somewhere between meh and bad

still watchable tho

#That was a pretty nice ending all things considered.   

So we got to see AnchoR unleash and wreck that big spider from the inside AND turned into an older, bigger Anchor... wew...  

And Naoto and Marie repaired the space tree which i guess saved tokyo.  Old man river did call marie Y as well sop maybe he is right and both of them are Y since they both posses crazy powers.  

The day is saved and team Y head to sea with the gang.  Halter has a new body and AnchoR is repaired and now they are on a mission to fix the world!  

I enjoyed this series a ton.  Very fun and cool.  And lots of gears.  I like gears.  

[](#feelsgoodman)
My biggest complaint with this show is that it didn't get better animation. That doesn't keep me from making it my favorite from this season though. I just enjoyed it way too much.
I actually enjoyed this show, it wasn't the greatest of the season by far but I thought the ending was pretty nice and it kept me interested enough to come back each week.

SukaSuka and Re:Creators are better from a technical standpoint I think, but damn if I didn't enjoy the hell out of this show. The characters were fantastic and easily carry the plot and animation for me.

So far I've enjoyed this show quote a bit more than re:creators.

I agree re:creators is better from a technical standpoint, but it's not nearly as fun a show as this one.
This show is just fun incarnate.

[Okay but why was she suddenly a grown up here?](http://i.imgur.com/zDraacE.jpg)

Overall I enjoyed it a lot more than I thought I would. RyuZU absolutely made the show for me, she was always on sass overload and it was fantastic.

> Okay but why was she suddenly a grown up here?

That was her HDD transform.
Not enough [personality shift](http://imgur.com/a/G8tdW)
this series went from 'the character design is weird but I'll let it pass' to 'lol wtf' to 'no, seriously, wtf is going on'

Xebec sure delivered ;_;

Pretty sad considering Madhouse translated the art style from same artist [quite well](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunday_Without_God).
Oh so thats why it looked familiar. Too bad Sunday Without God was only good for the first arc...

Alright, I liked this episode, however, there's a thing that still bothers me at the end of it.  
Who the fuck still uses battleships in the future?
It's not really the future. And I mean, they're using propellers for their planes, so maybe the technology for airships just isn't there.
Well that was a half decent show but the ending was very see you in the light novel/manga which isn't necessarily a bad thing but i just have a sneaking suspicion that this wont get a second season
so, how does making a sakura tree from gears can stop a mecha from firing it's mega particle cannon?

IIRC the original plan was for Team Naoto to use the Tree (which was basically the control centre for the entire grid) to heat up the area to interfere with/disable the electromagnetic-based mech. 

The mech preemptively wrecked the Tree, so Team Naoto had to fix the Tree so that they could resume their initial plan

So the Tree got fixed, and the increased temperature combined with the damage AnchoR already inflicted on the mech basically shut down and destroyed the mech.
What

Biggest disappointment of the season for me. 3/10. 

From the premise, the world, and the little bit I read of the manga (courtesy of an anime subscription box) I was hoping for a dystopian sci-fi with a seinen feel (my fave) and a steampunk aesthetic (a sweet bonus). Instead, I got a bad, cringey shounen. :( Finished it anyway, but man.
You're a real hero. A reasonable ranking in a sea of "it was fine I guess, definitely 7+"
People that say "that was okay I guess so it's a 7" are why MAL scores are broken.

It seems me that everyone ranking it highly is doing so not because they think it was a technically proficient show, but because they enjoyed the hell out of it.

As a great man one said, "Go beyond the impossible and kick reason to the curb!"

The impossible is giving this a high score. Sure, the animation was pretty bad, especially for 2017. The story was pretty weak, and I don't even know what the theme was.

But heck, I looked forward to this show the most every season. One I realized what the show was going to be, I just sat back and enjoyed it.

Yeah...personally, this is the worst anime I've ever watched *to completion*.  I mean, there's stupid little things that I've rated lower, like [Tenshi no Drop](https://myanimelist.net/anime/16436/Tenshi_no_Drop), but as far as a full-cour anime, this is a new low for me.  I think the only reason I was able to finish it is that it was so dull. I really disliked Mahouka because of The Cult of Onii-sama, dropping it halfway through the first cour. However, I can at least say that it was technically well executed in many aspects, even if the absurd power of the MC and everyone fawning over him grated on me until it was too much for me to bear. If I didn't have that particular pet peeve, I'm sure I could enjoy it. This show, on the other hand, was hot garbage in almost every way (except perhaps the music, which was passable).

I understand that some shows can be fun even if they're not particularly brilliant, and a lot of folks have made that argument in the discussion threads. If you enjoyed it, more power to ya—it's a matter of personal taste.  But I simply couldn't get any enjoyment out of this show.

Seems Anchor can HDD transform.  And nobody, not even Naoto or Anchor, even bat an eye anymore when Marie sucker-punches him to the ground for no reason.  But it probably doesn't hurt him because of the unique physics of the place.

One of the quickly growing list of 7/10s this season.
I liked it.  I really did. I'll miss this show . It wasn''t great, but it was very enjoyable for me

I liked this.

Everything is extremely weird, but I guess I like weird.

The character designs weren't particularly good, but each of them has a memorable personality, so that gets a pass.

Now, I want answers about materialising stuff from nowhere. Imaginary gears is a concept we have heard before, but I never thought it was literal in this way, I'd have guessed that it had to do with higher dimensions or something.

well all in all I'd say it wasn't terrible the story was interesting enough that I kept with it just to see where they were going with things but the animation really could've used some work...like the movement on that ship at the end of the episode was terrible
tbh that's some [world reconsecration magic](http://i.imgur.com/P3MSxoL.jpg) right there.
The black lagoon life chose them

I still can't shake this vague feeling that this show is actually from 2007~ish, but this was pretty fun regardless. 

A bit non-sensual towards the final episodes since the show omitted apparently important details that make some of the stuff that happened here not actually magic, and the animation itself is rigid, but everything else was actually not so bad.

I like how that one guy had completely accepted being in a sex-doll body by the final episode, even though he could probably get a more combat ready one after that final fight. Hell, I like how he just decided to stick with them just for the fun of it
ITT: 'Yeah, it sucked. *But in a really good way*, you know?'
where light novel pick up??
Did anyone notice in anchor's other form she has oppai, pretty big ones to

Not really a great ending but I still had fun with this show. Just watching Naoto indulge in his fetishes and interact with RyuZU was worth watching the entire thing. 7/10 I guess. Not bad but not the best either. I just wished we got the pleasure automaton to join the crew a lot earlier, as childish as it sounds I actually find her (his?) innuendos hilarious.
Sooo... did this show get good eventually?

hmmm, the last two episodes seem very rushed. this is a show i would watch at the start of my weekly binge to get it out the way. It does manage to keep pace and stay consistent with the story, but there are several cringey scenes in my opinion. Seems like a show that belongs in like 2008
Finally, this trash is over. Now I can pick it up, finish it in a day and forget about it forever.
I don't think I could handle watching it all at once. Stuff like Clockwork Planet is much easier on a weekly basis, at least for me.
Why even bother? There's no harm in not watching it.

My job is to watch everything from a season and review it. In the end, I saved shows that I couldn't handle watching week to week for the end. Examples being Tsugumomo, Tsuki ga Kirei, Clockwork Planet, Zero kara and Shuumatsu
Have you considered watching anime with the mindset of actually enjoying it? ¯\\\_(ツ)_/¯

> Tsugumomo, Tsuki ga Kirei, ..., Zero kara, Shuumatsu

Shit taste confirmed.
It's after the first episode so they could get a lot better after that. I'll decide soon
not liking the first episode of SukaSuka?
I hope you have fun and enjoy yourself!

My window's open, so I'm pretty sure my neighbors are wondering why I suddenly laughed so hard. Very good use of this gif.
